ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Gained a deeper appreciation of the different types of documentary films, and the range of ways and techniques used to create and tell a story through filmmaking.
I learned more about the different types of documentaries or film that exist and how different you can take the documentary medium.
My ability to make non-traditional documentaries increased tremendously. My exposure to new, avant-garde films expanded my perception of the very notion of documentary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the films we watched, and the workload of the class did not create stress. Also enjoyed being able to work on my personal film in my own time and to share it with the class at the end of the semester.

Strengths = You do get more access or exposure to other documentary film. 
Weaknesses = The class is way way too long for what it needs to be. There is no teaching in this class so a lot of the time, it felt like I was learning nothing for 4 hours. I think this class could be shortened to MAX 2 hours and could include much more discussion and teaching about documentary film and how you can express it. I sometimes felt uncomfortable during the class with the heavy amount of nakedness involved in the films we watched.
I believe the course really forced you to engage with the material individually which was helpful as no person was explaining how exactly to understand the media we were shown.
Loved the films we watched, but it would be great to include more traditional documentaries and classes focused on the technical aspect of film.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially for those who are interested in film and related fields.
Yes to anyone who is interested in filmmaking, or being exposed to many different forms of documentary film.

I would not recommend this course to another student because there are many other classes that would be engaging without having to be in a room doing nothing for 4 hours. If a student is really dedicated to and interested in watching film and gaining exposure to the different types of film out there, as well as showing film, than I do think this class would be good.
Highly, if you are at all interested in documentary, this is an excellent course to take.
